message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the security of network coding, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). It specifically focuses on the vulnerability of a specific network coding scheme (MRD code based universal secure network coding) against eavesdroppers, which falls under the category of cryptography and security (cs.CR). The paper also discusses the impact of the eavesdropping on the network performance, which is related to network infrastructure (cs.NI). Additionally, the paper proposes some conditions for the code to be secure, which involves mathematical analysis and optimization (cs.CC). Finally, the paper considers the duration of tapping links, which is related to the timing of events in the network (cs.SI).
